channel.title: David Harvey's Anti-Capitalist Chronicles
channel.itunes:summary: The Anti-Capitalist Chronicles look at capitalism through a Marxist lens. Support the show on Patreon and get early access to episodes and more: https://www.patreon.com/davidharveyacc
channel.itunes:author: David Harvey
channel.description: The Anti-Capitalist Chronicles look at capitalism through a Marxist lens. Support the show on Patreon and get early access to episodes and more: https://www.patreon.com/davidharveyacc

item.title: The significance of China in the Global Economy
item.itunes:title: The significance of China in the Global Economy
item.description: The Chinese economy is now the 2nd largest in the world. Prof. Harvey argues that China's expansion saved capitalism after the 2008 crash.
item.content:encoded: The Chinese economy is now the 2nd largest in the world. Prof. Harvey argues that China's expansion saved capitalism after the 2008 crash.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Chinese economy is now the 2nd largest in the world. Prof. Harvey argues that China's expansion saved capitalism after the 2008 crash.
item.itunes:summary: The Chinese economy is now the 2nd largest in the world. Prof. Harvey argues that China's expansion saved capitalism after the 2008 crash.
item.itunes:author: Democracy at Work

item.title: Does Socialism Affect Freedom?
item.itunes:title: Does Socialism Affect Freedom?
item.description: Does socialism require the surrender of individual freedom? The realm of freedom begins when the realm of necessity is left behind. Is freedom of the market real freedom?  And what about justice?  Prof. Harvey tries to answer these questions and more.
item.content:encoded: Does socialism require the surrender of individual freedom? The realm of freedom begins when the realm of necessity is left behind. Is freedom of the market real freedom?  And what about justice?  Prof. Harvey tries to answer these questions and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does socialism require the surrender of individual freedom? The realm of freedom begins when the realm of necessity is left behind. Is freedom of the market real freedom? And what about justice? Prof. Harvey tries to answer these questions...
item.itunes:summary: Does socialism require the surrender of individual freedom? The realm of freedom begins when the realm of necessity is left behind. Is freedom of the market real freedom? And what about justice? Prof. Harvey tries to answer these questions and more.

item.title: The Value of Everything
item.itunes:title: "The Value of Everything
item.description: Prof. Harvey talks about Mariana Mazzucato's new book "The Value of Everything: Making and Taking in the Global Economy."

item.title: The Brazilian Elections
item.itunes:title: The Brazilian Elections
item.description: Prof. Harvey talks about the recent Brazilian elections and the growing alliance between Neo-liberalism and Right-Wing Populism.
item.content:encoded: Prof. Harvey talks about the recent Brazilian elections and the growing alliance between Neo-liberalism and Right-Wing Populism.

item.title: The Financialization of Power
item.itunes:title: The Financialization of Power
item.description: Financial services become part of GDP in the 1970s and legitimize the power of financial institutions.

item.title: A brief history of Neo-Liberalism
item.itunes:title: A brief history of Neo-Liberalism
item.description:
Prof. David Harvey's pilot episode. He provides a quick history of the rise and growth of Neo-Liberalism. 

Support the show on Patreon and get early access to episodes and more: https://www.patreon.com/davidharveyacc
